_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FEDERAL RMP

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Stanislaus Farm Supply Company
Modesto Facility


1.    Facility Accidental Release Policy

The owners, management, and employees of Stanislaus Farm Supply Company, Modesto facility (herein referred to as the Facility) at 624 East Service Road, Modesto, CA, 95358 are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia, aqua ammonia, and regulated pesticides.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  A detailed emergency response plan has been developed and will be implemented in the event of an accidental release.

2.    Facility Information

?    The primary activity at the Stanislaus Farm Supply ? Modesto Facility is the storage, blending, and sale of fertilizers, in addition to, the sale of pre-packaged agricultural chemicals to farmers.
    
?    Anhydrous ammonia and aqua ammonia are received, stored, and distributed for both direct application and for blending into mixed grade fertilizers for crop production nutrients.  No federally regulated pesticides are handled at Stanislaus Farm Supply ? Modesto Facility.
    
?    Anhydrous ammonia is received by tanker truck and stored in 2 above ground tanks at the site.  The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia handled in stationary storage tanks is 112,000 pounds. Anhydrous ammonia is transferred to 95 field application tanks. The field application tanks are stored at the Facility until they transported to the end-user. The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia stored in field application tanks is 301,000 pounds.
    
?    Aqua ammonia is received by tanker truck or from the on-site converter and stored in 2 above ground tank(s) at the site.  The maximum quantity of aqua ammonia handled is 225,000 pounds.
    
3.    Accidental Release Prevention Program

Anhydrous Ammonia and Aqua Ammonia:  The Facility has implemented

the provisions of the "Safety Requirements for Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc.; California Code of Regulations, Title 8, Subchapter 1, "Unfired Pressure Vessel Safety Orders"; and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia."

Pesticides: The Facility has implemented provisions of the National Fire Protection Association and Uniform Fire Code for the storage of pesticides at their facility;  U.S. OSHA, 29 CFR 1910.38, "Employee emergency response plan and fire prevention plans"; and U.S. OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120, "Hazardous waste operations and emergency response."   


4.    Five-year Accident History
    
?    There have been no accidental releases or near misses of anhydrous ammonia, aqua ammonia, or regulated pesticides in the past five years that:
    
        have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor
    
        have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property  damage, or environmental damage.


5.    The Emergency Response Program

The facility's emergency response program was written in accordance with the following regulations:

     ?    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38;

     ?    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120; and

     ?    Section 25503, Division 6.95 of the California Health and Safety Code

The Stanislaus Farm Supply emergency response program includes combined training exercises with local government first responders, site evacuation drills, and specific training to enhance on-site emergency response capabilities as per applicable state and federal regulations. 

6.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific planned changes to the anhydrous ammonia or aqua ammonia processes at the facility.
